On 19 January 2022, in Miraflores (Guaviare), for a third consecutive day, about 600 farmers from the rural areas protested against the shut down of a local road that connects the rural areas with the municipality of Calamar. The group marched through the city and subsequently, a smaller group of 3 indigenous Wayuu began a hunger strike near the municipal hall. [size=no report]

Around 17 December 2021, in Pereira (Risaralda), relatives of people detained in China protested to demand government intervention for the extradition of the prisoners. The demonstrators mentioned the poor state of health of many of the detained Colombian citizens. They also asked for a commission to verify the conditions of detention of the prisoners. [size=no report]

On 17 December 2021, in El Centro (Santander), oil workers protested near an oil field. The group occupied the facilities for several hours. Although the reason for the protest was not mentioned, the workers have been demanding better working conditions and the issue of formal contracts with the company for several months. [size=no report]

On 17 December 2021, in Yondo (Antioquia), oil workers protested near an oil field. Although the reason for the protests was not mentioned, the workers have been demanding better working conditions and the issue of formal contracts with the company for several months. [size=no report]

On 17 December 2021, in Barrancabermeja (Santander), oil workers protested near an oil field. Although the reason for the protest was not mentioned, the workers have been demanding better working conditions and the issue of formal contracts with the company for several months. The group blocked access to the facilities for several hours. [size=no report]

Around 16 December 2021, in El Palo (Cauca), farmers protested against the invasion of their territories by Nasa indigenous people. Indigenous people claimed that the lands were part of their ancestral territories. Protesters blocked the road to demand government support to evict the indigenous people inside their plots of land. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2021, in Ibague (Tolima), residents protested against a water cut in the area. Residents claimed that they have been without a drinking water supply for several days and demanded the reconnection of the service. [size=no report]

Around 16 December 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Saldana municipality (Tolima), students and their parents protested against the shutdown of a rural school in the Papagala vereda. The group gathered during an official visit from the departmental Secretary of Education and raised their concerns over access to education for children in the area. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2021, in Bogota - La Candelaria, farmers from the municipalities of Mariquita, Fresno, Palocabildo, Chaparral, and Casabianca (Tolima) protested against the high cost of supplies and excessive loan rates for small farmers. The group demanded the sanction of a law that protects small producers. The group chained themselves to the Ministry of Agriculture and the congress for three and five days, respectively. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2021, in Yondo (Antioquia), oil workers protested near an oil field. Although the reason for the protests was not mentioned, the workers have been demanding better working conditions and the creation of formal contracts with the company for months. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), workers from the tourism industry protested in Bocagrande area against a law that would regulate tourism services on the shore areas. Protesters reported the lack of socialization of the project with local communities and tour operators. [size=no report]

On 16 December 2021, in El Centro (Santander), oil workers protested near an oil field. The group occupied the facilities for several hours. Although the reason for the protest was not mentioned, the workers have been demanding better working conditions and the creation of formal contracts with the company for months. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Teachers (Colombia); FECODE: Colombian Federation of Education Workers
notes: Around 15 December 2021, in Bogota - La Candelaria (Bogota, D.C.), teachers from Magdalena and Cordoba departments gathered near the Ministry of Education to protest against personnel shortage in the departments. The group expressed their concern over the lack of teachers to cover the demand of students in those areas of the country. FECODE participated in the event. [size=no report]

Around 15 December 2021, near Ibague (Tolima), residents of a children's shelter in the Ambala vereda staged a demonstration after it was announced that some of the residents would be relocated to other institutions. Youths destroyed several furniture and part of the facilities claiming the transfer was not previously consulted with their families. [size=no report]

On 15 December 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), residents of the Olaya Herrera neighborhood protested against the increase in the number of cases of people sick with dengue fever. The group marched after two residents died due to the disease and demanded government support for more prevention campaigns among residents. [size=no report]

Around 14 December 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Santa Marta (Magdalena), cab drivers protested against the presence of a speed radar in the area of Pozos Colorados. The protesters claimed that in this area the presence of these devices is illegal and demanded more transparency in the application of fines to drivers who circulate above the speed limit. [size=no report]

On 14 December 2021, in Cucuta (Norte de Santander), hundreds of police officers and other citizens gathered at a candlelight vigil to protest against the killing of police officers on duty on the same day after an explosion by an unidentified armed group. The event was organized by the police. [size=hundreds]

On 14 December 2021, in Piedecuesta (Santander), taxi drivers protested against delays in the pavement repair work on the local freeway. The group organized a motorcade and drove at slow speed across the city for several hours. [size=no report]

On 14 December 2021, in Bucaramanga (Santander), citizens gathered at a candlelight vigil to protest against the killing of two police officers on duty on the same day after an explosion by an unidentified armed group. The event was organized by the local police. [size=no report]

On 13 December 2021, in Portico (Norte de Santander), residents of the El Paramo area protested against the poor road infrastructure in the neighborhood. The group protested at the road and claimed that the regular traffic of trucks from companies in the area and other vehicles damaged the pavement. Protesters demanded improvements in the roads and other infrastructure, such as the sewer system. [size=no report]

On 13 December 2021, in San Gil (Santander), for the third consecutive day, residents of the Villa Olimpica and Antonio Galan neighborhoods demonstrated against the poor road infrastructure in the area. The group blocked the streets with barricades to demand improvements in pavement and road infrastructure. [size=no report]

On 13 December 2021, in Bucaramanga (Santander) residents of Comuna 13 protested against increasing violence and insecurity in their neighborhood. The group gathered during a visit of government officials and demanded a meeting with the city's mayor. [size=no report]

On 13 December 2021, in Bucaramanga (Santander), bus drivers protested against the lack of job security and delays in the payment of their salaries. The group gathered near the bus company's headquarters and blocked the entrance after several workers were temporarily laid off due to a lack of contracts. In addition, the group urged the authorities to pay the debt. [size=no report]

On 12 December 2021, in San Gil (Santander), for the second consecutive day, residents of the Villa Olimpica and Antonio Galan neighborhoods demonstrated against the poor road infrastructure in the area. The group blocked the streets with barricades to demand improvements in pavement and road infrastructure. [size=no report]

On 12 December 2021, in Bayunca (Bolivar), citizens demonstrated near the area where the communal council elections were held. Rioters set tires to fire to block the main entrance to the voting precinct and a nearby avenue. The demonstrators denounced a lack of transparency in the election process after a group of candidates withdrew from the electoral contest, claiming inconsistencies in the number of eligible persons to vote. The elections had to be postponed due to the demonstration. [size=no report]

On 11 December 2021, in Rionegro (Antioquia), hundreds of bus drivers and other citizens protested against the implementation of a new bus service system. Protesters claimed that the process has been poorly discussed and does not meet the needs of users. The protesters gathered in the Parque La Libertad for several hours. [size=hundreds]

On 11 December 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), citizens and employees of local toll booths demonstrated near the Mamonal area in counter-demonstrations. While citizens opposed the payment of tolls within the city because of the high costs for residents, workers demanded their right to work. There were fistfights between the two groups. [size=no report]

On 11 December 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), citizens and employees of local toll booths demonstrated near the Mamonal area in counter-demonstrations. While citizens opposed the payment of tolls within the city because of the high costs for residents, workers demanded their right to work. There were fistfights between the two groups. [size=no report]

On 11 December 2021, in San Gil (Santander), residents of the Villa Olimpica and Antonio Galan neighborhoods demonstrated against the poor road infrastructure in the area. The group blocked the streets with barricades to demand improvements in pavement and road infrastructure. [size=no report]

Around 10 December 2021, in Macajan (Sucre), residents protested against gender-based violence. The group gathered to demand justice for a victim of femicide. The event was promoted by the Mayor's office of Toluviejo municipality. [size=no report]

On 10 December 2021, in Santiago de Cali (Valle del Cauca), more than 2,000 Indigenous people protested in several municipalities against the increasing number of killings and attacks against social leaders and political activists. The event was part of the Minga mobilization, an indigenous gathering. [size=more than 2,000]

On 10 December 2021, in Puerto Colombia (Atlantico), residents of the Brisas del Puerto neighborhood staged a demonstration against the lack of an operative sewer system. Rioters blocked a nearby road with barricades to demand improvements in the infrastructure. [size=no report]

notes: On 10 December 2021, in Cucuta (Norte de Santander), 15 women and social leaders from Colombia and Venezuela protested against gender-based violence. The group cycled through the city calling for an end to domestic violence and other forms of violence against women. The event was organized by an international NGO. [size=15]

On 9 December 2021, in Santiago de Cali (Valle del Cauca), employees of the municipal public company demonstrated against the opening of a bidding process for traffic and street lighting in the city. The demonstrators built and set fire to barricades, claiming that the bidding process could affect the company's revenues. [size=no report]

On 9 December 2021, in Turbaco (Bolivar), citizens blocked the main avenue to protest against long lines to process passports. The group claimed they have been waiting in line for several days and demanded a more efficient system. [size=no report]

On 8 December 2021, in Medellin (Antioquia), store owners at the Pueblito Paisa, in the Nutibara hill, protested against the restriction of private vehicles to drive up the hill. The mayor's office restricted vehicles to protect local ecosystems in the area, whereas vendors claimed the decision has affected their sales. [size=no report]

Around 8 December 2021, in La Fortuna (Santander), residents protested against a water cut in the area. Residents alleged that they have been without a drinking water supply for several days and demanded the reconnection of the service. [size=no report]

Around 7 December 2021 (as reported), in Providencia y Santa Catalina (San Andres y Providencia), Raizal indigenous people protested against the construction of a naval base on the island. Protesters claimed the project would cause environmental damages in an area where endemic fish species reproduce. The group has been occupying the area where the project would be developed for more than 271 days. [size=no report]

Around 7 December 2021, in Barrancabermeja (Santander), residents of the 22 de Marzo neighborhood protested against the poor road conditions and the lack of maintenance of the streets. Protesters blocked the traffic to demand improvements to the road infrastructure. [size=no report]

On 6 December 2021, near Rionegro municipality (Antioquia), bus drivers protested against the implementation of a new bus service system. Drivers claimed that the process has been poorly socialized and does not meet the needs of users. The protesters blocked the road that connects the municipality with the Jose Maria Cordoba airport. [size=no report]

On 6 December 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), employees of local toll booths protested to demand their right to work. The group gathered near the Mamonal area after one of the tolls was shut down and other ones were been sabotaged by citizens that oppose the payment of tolls within the city. [size=no report]

On 6 December 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), residents of the Arroz Barato area protested against the poor road infrastructure in the neighborhood. The group claimed that the regular traffic of trucks and other vehicles damaged the pavement and risks the life of residents, as these vehicles drive at high speed. [size=no report]

On 6 December 2021, in Puerto Badel (Bolivar), residents protested against the bad conditions of the local road. Protesters blocked the road to access the headquarters of the water and sewerage that supplies the city of Cartagena to demand improvements to the tow's road infrastructure. The group claim this obstructs the access of ambulances to the area affecting the access of residents to health services. [size=no report]

On 3 December 2021, in Manizales (Caldas), anti-vaccination protesters rallied to demand an end to the restrictions introduced amid the coronavirus pandemic. They protested against the need to present a vaccination card for entrance into several businesses. [size=no report]

Around 3 December 2021, in Floridablanca (Santander), prisoners demonstrated at a local jail against the poor quality of the food and the mistreatment received in the penitentiary. The group set fire to a blanket and attacked a prison guard to demand better conditions inside the facility. ESMAD police forces intervened in the demonstration to force prisoners out of their cells. [size=no report]

Around 2 December 2021, in Bogota - Teusaquillo (Bogota, D.C.), teachers' union leaders protested in front of the Ministry of Education building to demand from the National Government compliance with the agreements made with the union, such as better payment rates and increases in the national budget for education. [size=no report]

source: Vanguardia Liberal; El Colombiano; El Comercio (Ecuador)
notes: On 1 December 2021, in Ipiales (Narino), Colombian truck drivers and store owners blocked the Rumichaca international bridge to demand the reopening of the border with Ecuador, closed by Ecuadorian and Colombian authorities due to the coronavirus pandemic. Meanwhile, a second group of about 10 people gathered in the main square and chanted slogans against the mayor. Protests broke out as the government authorities announced a delay in the reopening due to the identification of a new coronavirus variant. Protesters reported extensive economic losses due to the closure. [size=at least 10]

Around 1 December 2021, in the rural area of Mazamorrero (Cauca), Afro-Colombian people blocked the road to protest against the kidnapping of two members of their community by suspected FARC dissidents of the Jaime Martinez Front (coded separately). The protesters demanded the presence of state agencies to attend to the victims. [size=no report]

Around 1 December 2021, in Bogota - Teusaquillo (Bogota, D.C.), Afro-Colombian women from the Cauca department protested against increasing violence in their territories. Protesters took over the facilities of the National Land Agency to demand from the National Government to guarantee the rights and safety of Afro-Colombian communities. [size=no report]

On 1 December 2021, in Bucaramanga (Santander), 80 Yukpa indigenous people arrived at the town hall to protest against the lack of economic support from the government to fight the food crisis suffered by the Yukpa communities. The protesters made a temporary settlement in a nearby park. [size=80]

On 30 November 2021, in Bucaramanga (Santander), relatives and other women protested against the death of a child after a sexual assault. The group gathered near the General Attorney's building to demand justice for the victim and more advances in the police investigation. In addition, the group demanded respect for children's rights, including an end to gender-based and sexual violence. [size=no report]

On 29 November 2021, in San Juan Del Cesar (La Guajira), nearly 70 livestock farmers blocked the road that connects the department of La Guajira and Cesar to protest against the increasing cattle raiding in the area. The group blocked nearly 200 vehicles for several hours to demand more security. [size=nearly 70]

On 29 November 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), residents of the San Francisco neighborhood protested against their exclusion from government aid assigned to families after land subsidence destroyed several houses in 2011. The group blocked several streets and claimed that, even though their neighborhood was one of the most affected by the natural disaster, they have not received any help from the government. [size=no report]

On 28 November 2021, in Bogota - Bosa(Bogota, D.C.), rioters and ESMAD police forces clashed in the Chicala neighborhood when the former attempted to block the traffic in the Av. Ciudad de Cali. Demonstrators used Molotov bombs and other objects to attack officers. One demonstrator was arrested after attacking an officer with a machete knife. Two officers were injured. There were no details about the motives of the demonstration. [size=no report]

Around 26 November 2021 (as reported), in the rural area of Ubala municipality (Cundinamarca), residents of the Zona B area protested against the development of an oil exploration project in the area. Residents expressed environmental concerns. [size=no report]

On 26 November 2021, in Ibague (Tolima), citizens demonstrated against the poor road and sewer infrastructure in the Comuna 9 area. The group used furniture to barricade a main road and demand improvements. [size=no report]

On 25 November 2021, in Bogota - Usme (Bogota, D.C.), demonstrators gathered and built barricades near the Portal Usme and Yomasa area. The demonstration was part of ongoing anti-government demonstrations called by the National Strike Committee to demand health, education, and security reforms, among others. Likewise, the group demanded accountability for cases of excessive use of force by police officers. Police reported several clashes with demonstrators and one person arrested. [size=no report]

On 25 November 2021, in Bogota - La Candelaria (Bogota, D.C.), between 50 to 100 peaceful protesters gathered in the Parque Nacional (Bogota - Santa Fe), Parque Ciudad Jardin (Bogota - Antonio Narino), and the Mariposa Square (Bogota - Santa Fe) and marched in direction to the Bolivar Square (Bogota - La Candelaria). On 21 November 2021, in Bogota - Bosa (Bogota, D.C.), rioters and ESMAD police forces clashed during demonstrations near the Portal Americas area. The clashes lasted until dawn the following day. The reasons for the demonstration were not mentioned, but sources stated that the group potentially gathered to demand accountability for cases of excessive use of force by police officers. In total four officers were injured in Bosa and Kennedy. [size=no report]

On 20 November 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), relatives and other citizens protested against the disappearance of a teenager eight months ago. Around 19 November 2021 (as reported), in Cartagena (Bolivar), nearly 70 professional typists protested over delays in the payment of their salary wages. The group urged authorities to pay the debt. [size=nearly 70]

On 18 November 2021, in Bogota - La Candelaria (Bogota, D.C.), a hundred demonstrators, mostly women, clashed during pro-abortion and anti-abortion rallies held in the city center. Around 16 November 2021, in Riohacha (La Guajira), about 30 dump truck drivers protested against the exclusion of local labor for the construction of a penitentiary building in the city. On 14 November 2021, in Bucaramanga (Santander), citizens protested against the development of mining projects in natural reserve areas of the department. Protesters organized a motorcade across the city to demand from the government the protection of the environment. [size=no report]

source: Diario La Libertad; El Heraldo (Colombia); El Espectador
notes: On 13 November 2021, in the rural area of Bolivar municipality (Santander), ESMAD police forces and demonstrators clashed during a rally held by residents of the La Hermosura corregimiento. Three people were arrested, three police officers were reported injured, and a demonstrator died five days after being hospitalized due to the impact of a tear gas canister in the head. 1 fatality. In addition, the group complains about the increasing number of police operations to seize mining equipment from small-scale miners. [size=no report]

On 20 October 2021, near Uribia municipality (La Guajira), about fifty Wayuu indigenous people sat on plastic chairs on the rails to block the railway line of a coal mine to demand an increase in compensation for the use of their ancestral territory by the mining company. [size=about fifty]

On 19 October 2021, in Sincelejo (Sucre), workers and lawyers of the General Attorney offices protested against poor working conditions in the offices. The group gathered near the offices in the Cruz de Colorado neighborhood and demanded improvements in the facilities. [size=no report]

On 19 October 2021, in Valledupar (Cesar), residents protested over damages to the sewage system in the El Paramo, Nuevo Milenio, Mareigua, and La Primavera neighborhood. On 19 October 2021, in El Hatillo, El Paso municipality (Cesar), a group of 50 people demonstrated near a local mine to demand that the company hire local residents. On 19 October 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), citizens protested delays by local authorities to remove a dead body from a pedestrian zone. Family members and other citizens blocked a nearby street for several hours. [size=no report]

On 17 October 2021, in Ansermanuevo (Valle del Cauca), citizens protested to demand justice for a local activist killed by unidentified attackers, on 8 October. The group gathered to demand progress in the police investigation to find the perpetrators. [size=no report]

On 16 October 2021, in Bucaramanga (Santander), patients at a rehabilitation center staged a demonstration against the mistreatment by the staff and the lack of adequate conditions for their treatments. The event followed a similar incident reported around 14 October in another facility. A fire broke out when one of the patients destroyed an electronic equipment, resulting in the death of three patients, among them a Venezuelan citizen. 3 fatalities. [size=no report]

On 16 October 2021, in Bucaramanga (Santander), patients at a rehabilitation center staged a demonstration against the mistreatment by the staff and the lack of adequate conditions for their treatments. The event followed a similar incident reported around 14 October in another facility. A fire broke out when one of the patients destroyed an electronic equipment, resulting in the death of three patients, among them a Venezuelan citizen. 3 fatalities. [size=no report]

On 16 October 2021, in Medellin (Antioquia), rioters and ESMAD police forces clashed during a demonstration held to demand justice for the victims of a military operation carried out by state forces in 2002. People marched near Avenida 80 demanding accountability from the military personnel involved in the massacre. Rioters threw Molotov cocktails at police officers and fights broke out between groups of rioters near the San Juan neighborhood. [size=no report]

On 16 October 2021, near San Marcos municipality (Sucre), residents demonstrated near a local gas company to demand that the company hire local residents. Around 15 October 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), about 30 kitchen workers of a local oil company protested against the contracting of an external company for food services. The workers stated that they have been working with the company for several years and demanded job security. [size=about 30]

Around 15 October 2021, in Socorro (Santander), salesmen protested the arrival of workers who would carry out repair work in the San Victorino sector. The group demanded the socialization of the project before starting the construction and expressed their disagreement since the construction would force them to close their businesses for several weeks. [size=no report]

On 15 October 2021, in Pereira (Risaralda), health care workers protested against poor working conditions. Protesters claimed they lack basic equipment to perform their jobs and demanded a better budget for hospitals and improvements in their work contracts. [size=no report]

On 14 October 2021, near Tuchin (Cordoba), at least 100 Zenu indigenous people protested against the lack of transparency in policies that support indigenous communities. Protesters blocked the traffic for several hours to demand a better budget and improvements in the government programs that benefit indigenous communities in the department. [size=at least 100]

Around 14 October 2021, in Puerto Tejada (Cauca), health workers and residents protested to demand justice for a doctor killed in a drive-by shooting on 12 October. The group marched to demand more security for health workers providing services in the area and called for a prompt investigation of the attack. [size=no report]

On 14 October 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar ), citizens blocked the main avenue to protest against long lines to pay the traffic tickets. The group claimed they have been waiting in line for several days and demanded a more efficient payment system. [size=no report]

On 14 October 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar ), citizens and local JAC members demanded public investments to improve the computer equipment and connectivity of local JACs. In addition, the group demanded improvements in garbage collection services in their neighborhoods. [size=no report]

Around 14 October 2021, in Bucaramanga (Santander), patients at a rehabilitation center staged a demonstration during a monitoring visit held by local authorities. The patients have denounced mistreatment by the staff and the lack of adequate conditions for their treatments. The police had to intervene and control the group when one of the workers was injured in the head by the rioters. There were no fatalities. [size=no report]

The patients have denounced mistreatment by the staff and the lack of adequate conditions for their treatments. The police had to intervene and control the group when one of the workers was injured in the head by the rioters. There were no fatalities. [size=no report]

On 13 October 2021, in Cucuta (Norte de Santander), citizens protested to demand the reopening of the local cemetery after complaining that they have not been able to visit the graves of their relatives since the management decided to close the facilities due to the coronavirus pandemic in March 2020. [size=no report]

On 13 October 2021, in San Calixto (Norte de Santander), residents protested against the death of a woman on 11 October, who was killed during an armed confrontation between two groups. Protesters demanded respect for the lives of civilians living in conflict zones. [size=no report]

On 12 October 2021, in Bogota - Usaquen (Bogota, D.C.), hundreds of environmental activists protested in front of the Canadian embassy against gold mining policies. The group gathered after a Canadian multinational filed a lawsuit against the country for violation of free trade agreements on mining and environmental protection. [size=hundreds]

On 12 October 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), residents of the El Pozon neighborhood protested against a case of medical negligence at the local hospital. The group rallied in front of the building following the report of the death of a child due to an illness omitted by the medical staff. [size=no report]

On 12 October 2021, in Barrancabermeja (Santander), residents of the Kikelandia neighborhood protested to demand improvements in the area's infrastructure. The group blocked the streets when a gas company team tried to pass through and demanded improvements in water and sewage services, sanitation, among others. [size=no report]

On 12 October 2021, in Bogota - San Cristobal (Bogota, D.C.), citizens held a demonstration near the 20 de Julio neighborhood in support of indigenous rights in the country. A group of demonstrators threw stones at a group of police officers who were attending a call for a robbery. [size=no report]

On 12 October 2021, in Bogota - San Cristobal (Bogota, D.C.), citizens held a demonstration near the 20 de Julio neighborhood in support of indigenous rights in the country. A group of demonstrators threw stones at a group of police officers who were attending a call for a robbery. [size=no report]

On 11 October 2021, in Ibague (Tolima), residents of the municipality of Ambalema protested near the Governor's office against the poor condition of the road leading to their municipality. The group demanded improvements to the road infrastructure. [size=no report]

On 11 October 2021, in Maria La Baja (Bolivar), health care workers protested against poor working conditions. Protesters claimed they lack basic equipment to perform their jobs and demanded a better budget for local hospitals. Moreover, protesters reported delays in the payment of their wages and urged authorities to pay the debt. [size=no report]

On 11 October 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), nearly 50 residents of the San Francisco neighborhood protested against their exclusion from government aid assigned to families after land subsidence destroyed several houses in 2011. The group blocked several streets and claimed that, even though their neighborhood was one of the most affected by the natural disaster, they have not received any help from the government. [size=nearly 50]

On 8 October 2021, in Maicao (La Guajira), citizens and business owners protested against increasing insecurity in the area. The group marched to demand more police presence after a resident was killed during a robbery. [size=no report]

On 8 October 2021, in Santiago De Cali (Valle del Cauca), employees of a local supermarket chain company protested against delays in the payment of their wages. The group gathered in several of the stores and urged company owners to pay the debt. [size=no report]

Around 8 October 2021, in La Jagua De Ibirico (Cesar), nearly 30 miners protested against the layoff of personnel. The group chained themselves to the entrance of the mining company to denounce that multiple workers lost their jobs and demanded job security. Additionally, the group began a hunger strike. [size=nearly 30]

On 8 October 2021, in San Basilio de Palenque, Mahates municipality (Bolivar), for the second time in a week, residents blocked a nearby highway for nearly six hours to demand the construction of a sports stadium in the town. The group claimed that the project has been delayed several times. [size=no report]

On 8 October 2021, in Bucaramanga (Santander), bus drivers protested against poor working conditions and delays in the payment of their wages. The group began a protest on 1 September and have gathered for 39 consecutive days near the bus company's headquarters to urge authorities to pay the debt. [size=no report]

On 8 October 2021, in Ipiales (Narino), for the fifth consecutive day, Colombian truck drivers blocked the Rumichaca international bridge to demand the reopening of the border with Ecuador, closed due to the coronavirus outbreak. Drivers reported extensive economic losses due to the closure. Police forces intervened and dispersed the group when the rioters attacked the vehicles of the Ecuadorian truckers who were allowed to cross the border. [size=no report]

On 7 October 2021, in Ibague (Tolima), dozens of residents of Baltazar and Industrial neighborhoods protested near Combeima to demand relocation after the destruction of several of their homes due to excessive rains in the region. [size=dozens]

On 7 October 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), citizens protested the temporary closures of coronavirus vaccination centers in the city. Local authorities reported that vaccination centers were closed for the day, which annoyed users who blocked traffic for several hours. [size=no report]

On 6 October 2021, in Valledupar (Cesar), African palm farmers protested against layoffs by a company that hires personnel in the area. The group gathered to demand job security and government aid to support companies that focus on agricultural production. [size=no report]

On 6 October 2021, in Bucaramanga (Santander), drivers working with ride-hailing applications protested against increased police controls. The group demanded their right to work and called for the legalization of ride-hailing apps. [size=no report]

On 6 October 2021, in Ipiales (Narino), for the third consecutive day, Colombian truck drivers blocked the Rumichaca international bridge to demand the reopening of the border with Ecuador, closed by Ecuadorian authorities due to the coronavirus outbreak. Drivers reported extensive economic losses due to the closure. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2021, in Santiago De Cali (Valle Del Cauca), health workers protested against delays in the payment of their wages. The group gathered near a municipal square and urged authorities to pay the debt. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2021, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), businessmen protested against the increasing number and duration of power outages. The group organized a candlelight vigil near the San Nicolas plaza claiming that the power outages affect their businesses and demanding improvements in service delivery. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2021, in San Basilio de Palenque, Mahates municipality (Bolivar), residents blocked a nearby highway for nearly six hours to demand the construction of a sports stadium in the town. The group claimed that the project has been delayed several times. [size=no report]

Around 5 October 2021 (as reported), in Turbaco (Bolivar), health workers protested against the arrest of the hospital manager for refusing to pay a debt that predated his tenure. The group gathered to show their support to the employee. [size=no report]

Around 5 October 2021, in Bogota - Santa Fe (Bogota, D.C.), nearly 800 indigenous people protested to demand government support after the group was displaced by armed groups from indigenous reserve areas in the Choco department. The group occupied land near the National Park and claimed that they would stay there until the authorities guaranteed their safety in their territories. [size=nearly 800]

On 5 October 2021, in Ipiales (Narino), for the second consecutive day, Colombian truck drivers blocked the Rumichaca international bridge to demand the reopening of the border with Ecuador, closed by Ecuadorian authorities due to the coronavirus outbreak. Around 4 October 2021, in Medellin (Antioquia), relatives and family members of prisoners protested against the poor quality of the food and the mistreatment received by prisoners at El Pedregal penitentiary. The group gathered near the building to demand better conditions inside the facility. [size=no report]

Around 4 October 2021, in Candelaria (Atlantico), residents demonstrated against an alleged case of medical negligence. Demonstrators gathered and threw stones at the city mayor's house after a resident died due to the lack of an ambulance service available for the patient. [size=no report]

On 1 October 2021, in Villavicencio (Meta), residents of the Playa Rica area protested to demand the construction of a pedestrian bridge. The group alleged that the construction of a nearby highway affected the safety of the residents. [size=no report]

On 1 October 2021, in Sincelejo (Sucre), teachers protested against delays in the payment of their wage increase for 2021. The group claimed that they have received payments corresponding to 2020 rates and urged local authorities to pay their debt. [size=no report]

On 1 October 2021, in Ibague (Tolima), residents of the Calarca neighborhood staged a pot-banging protest against a water cut in the area. The residents alleged that they have been without drinking water supply for several days and demanded the reconnection of the service. [size=no report]

On 30 September 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), residents protested to demand the repair of a statue of a local sportsman damaged four months ago. The group gathered to request the intervention of local authorities to fix the monument. [size=no report]

On 30 September 2021, in Bucaramanga (Santander), students and their families protested at a local school against the return of in-person classes. On 29 September 2021, in Floridablanca (Santander), health workers protested against delays in the payment of their wages. The group gathered near the health center in a candle vigil and urged authorities to pay the debt. [size=no report]

On 29 September 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), women members of an organization of victims of the armed conflict protested in the city center against delays in the allocation of resources for collective reparation programs for victims of displacement and other war crimes. [size=no report]

On 28 August 2021, in Bogota - Kennedy (Bogota, D.C.), rioters and ESMAD police forces clashed near the Portal Americas during ongoing anti-government demonstrations called by the National Strike Committee to reject a tax reform and to demand improvements in health, education, security, among others. Around 25 August 2021, in Ginebra (Valle del Cauca), citizens staged a protest to demand the release of a child abducted by unidentified men on 23 August, who later demanded ransom for the family. The group gathered in the town square and marched through the town. [size=no report]

Around 25 August 2021, in Medellin (Antioquia), 10 flower farmers and about 35 more people protested against the poor logistics experienced during the Festival of the Flower. Farmers (silleteros) complained after several of them were unable to exhibit their products during the festival. [size=about 45]

Around 25 August 2021, in Pereira (Risaralda), residents of the Pinares de San Martin neighborhood protested against authorities cutting down trees in the area. The group expressed concerns over the environmental impact and demanded a consultation with residents before proceeding with the felling. [size=no report]

Around 25 August 2021, in Quetame (Cundinamarca), business owners protested against dust in their store caused by the traffic of heavy-duty vehicles carrying debris on nearby roads. The group blocked the Llano freeway for several hours. [size=no report]

On 25 August 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), residents of the Getsemani neighborhood protested against increasing insecurity in the area. The group blocked the traffic to demanded the construction of a police precinct. [size=no report]

On 24 August 2021, in Ibague (Tolima), students and other citizens staged a candle vigil to protest against the killing of an independent journalist and student of a local university. The victim, who had an active role in the ongoing anti-government protests, was shot dead on 23 August 2021. Protesters demanded justice for the victim. [size=no report]

On 24 August 2021, in Medellin (Antioquia), 20 transexual members of a collective protested against police brutality against members of the LGBT community. The group staged a cultural performance calling for an end to violence and homophobia. [size=no report]

On 24 August 2021, in Pereira (Risaralda), citizens of Las Brisitas neighborhood protested against excessive delays in the construction of social housing projects. The group staged a rally to demand their right to access decent housing. [size=no report]

On 24 August 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), citizens staged a vigil on the day that mark one year of the death of teenager killed in a case of police brutality. Relatives and other citizens gathered in multiple cultural activities and demanded justice for the victim. [size=no report]

On 24 August 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), nearly 20 citizens protested against delays in the payment of house aid. The group had to abandon their residences after government officials detected structural defects in the building. Citizens claimed that the municipality hasn't provided any financial support to the people affected and demanded their right to decent housing. Moreover, they complained that some of the residences were illegally occupied by other citizens, despite the evacuation mandate. [size=nearly 20]

On 24 August 2021, in the rural area of Cartagena city (Bolivar), farmers protested against the eviction of several families from a private plot of land in the Mamonal area. The group demanded their right to decent housing. [size=no report]

On 24 August 2021, in the rural area of San Onofre (Sucre), residents and local farmers blocked the roadway that connects the rural areas with the municipal seat to demand improvements in the road infrastructure. Protesters claimed that the poor conditions of the pavement affect the local economy and the transport of goods to other areas. [size=no report]

On 24 August 2021, in Floridablanca (Santander), citizens continued to protest against excessive delays in the garbage collection service. The group used trash bags to block the streets and to demand a better service provision. [size=no report]

Around 23 August 2021 (as reported), in Santa Fe de las Claras corregimiento (Cordoba), farmers gathered to protest after military forces arrive at the area to carry out the eradication of coca fields. Farmers claimed previous agreements with the government included a voluntary substitution of illegal crops and only after the approval of landowners. The group blocked access to security forces to the area. [size=no report]

Around 23 August 2021, in La Paz (Cesar), Yukpa indigenous people demonstrated to demand justice for one member of the community killed in a hit-and-run accident. Officers reported several damages to police vehicles and other equipment caused by demonstrators. [size=no report]

One military officer was reported injured. [size=no report]

On 20 August 2021, in Cucuta (Norte de Santander), citizens protested in front of a medical center to demand the performance of medical procedures for their relatives. On 18 August 2021, in Buenaventura, Valle del Cauca, residents protested against the recurrent actions of violence in the city. [size=no report]

On 17 August 2021, near Las Animas vereda, Choco, indigenous people blocked the Panamericana road demanding fair payment to indigenous teachers and the construction of bridges inside of indigenous reserves. [size=no report]

On 17 August 2021, in Cartagena, Bolivar, a group of electricians of the Private Electricians Union of Cartagena protested against the proposed eviction from the Dager building. On 17 August 2021, in Bucaramanga, Santander, inspectors protested against the problems they face to access the Health Insurance Plan (EPS). They drew attention to the system failures and abuses, pointing that some families are split between different facilities. [size=no report]

On 15 August 2021, in Abrego, Norte de Santander, rioters set fire to a police vehicle during a demonstration after a man was killed by police officers. The case happened in the morning of that day, after an officer shot and killed an individual, while police responded to a fight inside a bar. [size=no report]

On 14 August 2021, in the rural area of Cajibio, Cauca, Misak indigenous farmers demanded, in El Arado vereda, the interruption of the Smurfit Kappa Carton company activities in the department. They claimed that the company's activities affect the food planting and cultivation and that the land belongs to the indigenous ancestors. They also demanded justice for the killing of a farmer by a police officer, during one of the demonstrations against the enterprise. [size=no report]

On 13 August 2021, in Cartagena, Bolivar, teachers from various municipalities blocked the road outside the Government building as part of a protest against the return of in-person classes. Protesters demanded effective measures to prevent the spread of the coronavirus pandemic and claimed they have no safety to return and pointed to the slow pace of the vaccination. [size=no report]

On 11 August 2021, in Pereira, Risaralda, parents, teachers, and students protested against the suspension of in-person classes in the department of Risaralda. The classes, which had been recently changed to in-person regime, were suspended due to a judge decision concerned with the coronavirus pandemic health measures. Protesters demanded the end of the virtual education and the immediate return to the in-person activities. [size=no report]

On 11 August 2021, in Dosquebradas, Risaralda, parents, teachers, and students protested against the suspension of in-person classes in the department of Risaralda. On 11 August 2021, near the rural area of Majagual municipality, Sucre, farmers blocked roads as part of a protest demanding the State to regulate the price of grains. Participants claimed that the price of selling is low while the price for buying resources is high. [size=no report]

On 11 August 2021, in Riohacha (La Guajira), indigenous people blocked the main entrance of a local landfill for ten days to protest against delays to complete development projects in their community. Protesters claimed that in return for allowing the construction of the landfill in reserve areas, the municipality agreed to compensate the community by improving infrastructure. [size=no report]

On 11 August 2021, in Ibague, Tolima, protesters blocked the Pedro Tarfur avenue as part of a protest against a property invasion in Simon Bolivar neighborhood. They used sticks and stones to prevent cars from passing. [size=no report]

notes: On 20 July 2021, in Bogota municipality, Bogota, D.C., about 5,000 workers and students gathered during the Independence day's anti-government demonstrations, called by the National Strike Committee. They demonstrated against a tax reform, and also to demand improvements in health, education, and security. They also called for an end to police brutality against participants and to economic assistance amid the coronavirus pandemic. At the end of the day, rioters damaged private buildings and Transmilenio BRT terminals. Authorities claim that, throughout the day, at least 60 people were injured, including 27 officers, one of them severely. 17 demonstrators were arrested across the city. [size=about 5,000]

notes: On 22 June 2021, in Santiago de Cali (Valle del Cauca), ESMAD joined with police and military forces to disperse protesters blocking Los Mil Dias bridge and Simon Bolivar highway during ongoing anti-government demonstrations to demand health, education, and security reforms despite the formal suspension of the National Strike. One thousand police and military personnel were reportedly used to clear the area. [size=no report]

source: El Tiempo (Colombia); Diario La Libertad; El Espectador
notes: On 21 June 2021, in Bogota - Usme (Bogota, D.C.), rioters threw Molotov cocktails at ESMAD forces, who responded with tear gas and flashbangs, resulting in two arrests, at least 75 injuries including 27 wounded police, and the death of a bystander in Yomasa sector. The event happened during ongoing anti-government demonstrations to demand health, education, and security reforms despite the formal suspension of the National Strike. The victim reportedly died after being hit in the chest by a tear gas canister. Demonstrations in the area also blocked traffic on the AutoSur highway. At least 75 injured, 1 fatality. [size=no report]

On 21 June 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), rioters clashed with police in Bomba del Amparo sector during a demonstration to demand Congress pass a free tuition law. One youth was shot and injured during the event, while three others were arrested, and seven police were injured. 8 wounded, no fatalities. [size=no report]

On 21 June 2021, in Soacha (Cundinamarca), rioters and police forces clashed during anti-government demonstrations demanding reforms to health, education, and security despite the suspension of the National Strike. There were reports of violence, but no particular episode was mentioned. [size=no report]

On 21 June 2021, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), students protested against the university's intention to continue with online classes due to the coronavirus outbreak. The group gathered near the university to demand the return to in-person classes. [size=no report]

On 21 June 2021, in Ibague (Tolima), a group of youth protesters blocked the intersection of 60th street and 5th avenue during ongoing anti-government demonstrations to demand health, education, and security reforms despite the formal suspension of the National Strike. The demonstrators also gathered in Murillo Toro park to protest against reports of dismembered bodies appearing around the country, and of police violence against demonstrators in Santiago de Cali in recent days. [size=no report]

[size=no report]

On 21 June 2021, in Santiago de Cali (Valle del Cauca), demonstrators clashed with police in Puerto Rellena sector, resulting in the death of an unidentified person and injuries to numerous babies and elderly people due to tear gas. Elsewhere in the city, rioters detained a truck and attempted to block the road by setting it on fire. These events occurred during ongoing anti-government demonstrations to demand health, education, and security reforms despite the formal suspension of the National Strike. 1 fatality. [size=no report]

On 21 June 2021, in Santiago de Cali (Valle del Cauca), protesters blocked roads and held rallies at six locations across the city during ongoing anti-government demonstrations to demand health, education, and security reforms despite the formal suspension of the National Strike. [size=no report]

Around 20 June 2021 (as reported), in Sibundoy municipality (Putumayo), for the 54th day, between 200 to 300 student protesters gathered to demand government funding for a public university in Putumayo department during ongoing anti-government demonstrations that also demanded health, education, and security reforms despite the formal suspension of the National Strike. [size=between 200 to 300]

Around 20 June 2021 (as reported), in a rural area of Puerto Asis (Putumayo), for the 54th day, around 80 farmers blocked roads in Brisas de Hong Kong vereda to demand government investment in rural areas and environmental protections. The event happened as part of ongoing anti-government demonstrations that also demanded health, education, and security reforms despite the formal suspension of the National Strike. [size=around 80]

Around 20 June 2021 (as reported), in Tunia vereda (Cauca), for the 54th day, dozens of protesters protested around the Tunia toll booth - which was destroyed during the National Strike - to demand government funding for local schools and a permanent end to toll roads. The event happened as part of the ongoing anti-government demonstrations that also demanded health, education, and security reforms despite the formal suspension of the National Strike. [size=dozens]

Around 20 June 2021 (as reported), in a rural area of Villagarzon (Putumayo), for the 54th day, around 50 indigenous Nasa protesters gathered near Costayaco oil field to demand government investment in rural areas and environmental protections. The event was part of ongoing anti-government demonstrations that also demanded health, education, and security reforms despite the formal suspension of the National Strike. [size=around 50]

On 19 June 2021, in Santiago de Cali (Valle del Cauca), protesters blocked roads and held rallies at five locations across the city during ongoing anti-government demonstrations to demand health, education, and security reforms despite the formal suspension of the National Strike. [size=no report]

On 19 June 2021, in Manaure Balcon del Cesar (Cesar), police opened fire on demonstrators who threw stones at the police station and demanded justice for a youth killed by police when he drove through a traffic stop earlier that day. A female social leader was shot and killed by police during the demonstration, while six police officers were reported injured. 6 wounded, 1 fatality. [size=no report]

On 19 June 2021, in Manaure Balcon del Cesar (Cesar), police opened fire on demonstrators who threw stones at the police station and demanded justice for a youth killed by police when he drove through a traffic stop earlier that day. On 18 June 2021, in Ibague (Tolima), peaceful protesters rallied during ongoing anti-government demonstrations to demand health, education, and security reforms, among others. Protesters dismissed the statement of pausing the mobilizations for the national strike and emphasized their disagreement with this decision. The group blocked the traffic for several hours. [size=no report]

On 18 June 2021, in Bucaramanga (Santander), rioters set on fire one tire during ongoing anti-government demonstrations to demand health, education, and security reforms, among others. Demonstrators dismissed the statement of pausing the mobilizations for the national strike and emphasized their disagreement with this decision. [size=no report]

On 18 June 2021, in Santiago De Cali (Valle del Cauca), rioters and ESMAD police forces clashed in three different areas of the city during ongoing anti-government demonstrations to demand health, education, and security reforms, among others. Demonstrators dismissed the statement of pausing the mobilizations for the national strike and emphasized their disagreement with this decision. Local organizations reported the clashes resulted in one person killed near the Mil Luchas bridge by a shot from police forces. Other sources reported that demonstrators set fire to several vehicles. 1 fatality. [size=no report]

Around 17 June 2021, in Rio Seco, Valledupar municipality (Cesar), Kankuamos indigenous people protested against increasing cases of violence against members of their community. The group gathered in the main square after reports of the disappearance of two women from the community became public. Protesters demanded justice for the victim and better measures to protect indigenous people. [size=no report]

Around 17 June 2021, in Atanquez, Valledupar municipality (Cesar), Kankuamos indigenous people protested against increasing cases of violence against members of their community. The group gathered in the main square after reports of the killing of one Kankuamo person became public. Protesters demanded justice for the victim and better measures to protect indigenous people. [size=no report]

On 17 June 2021, in Villanueva (Bolivar), inter-municipal bus drivers protested against poor public transport regulations. The group claimed that the local government has failed to control illegal vehicles, affecting their income. The group blocked one of the town's access for several hours. [size=no report]

On 17 June 2021, in Cucuta (Norte de Santander), citizens protested against the abduction of three teenagers, on 13 June. Victims' relatives and friends gathered near the police station to demand advances in the police investigation. [size=no report]

On 17 June 2021, in Bucaramanga (Santander), citizens protested against the construction of commercial shops in a local park. The group claimed that the construction of shops and a synthetic soccer field would reduce the access to green areas for residents. [size=no report]

source: El Pais (Colombia); El Espectador; AFP; El Tiempo (Colombia)
notes: On 17 June 2021, in Santiago De Cali (Valle del Cauca), rioters erected barricades during ongoing anti-government demonstrations to demand health, education, and security reforms, among others. Demonstrators dismissed the statement of pausing the mobilizations for the national strike and emphasized their disagreement with this decision. Rioters and ESMAD police forces clashed with some demonstrators armed with knives. Witnesses reported armed masked men, some of who broke into a local hospital looking for a patient. Demonstrators set fire to a bus of public service and a delivery truck. One demonstrator was killed by a gunshot under unspecified circumstances and four police officers were injured. [size=no report]

On 15 June 2021, in Barranquilla municipality (Atlantico), hundreds of citizens protested against a toll on the route that connects Barranquilla and nearby municipalities. Protesters reported high costs and demanded to be included in the payment exceptions or to shut down the facilities. Protesters marched towards the toll gate located on the outskirts of the city. [size=hundreds]

On 15 June 2021, in Baranoa municipality (Atlantico), citizens protested against a toll on the route that connects Baranoa and Barranquilla. On 13 June 2021, in Santiago de Cali (Valle del Cauca), thousands of protesters marched in Puerto Rellena and erected a Monument of Resistance in commemoration of those who have died during the National Strike. assoc_actor_1: Indigenous Group (Colombia); Farmers (Colombia); CRIC: Indigenous Regional Council of Cauca
notes: Around 12 June 2021 (as reported), in Tunia (Cauca), farmers and indigenous protesters organized by the CRIC lifted their blockade of the Pan-American highway in exchange for government promises not to resume operation of a toll booth in the area. The demonstrators also demanded police and military reform, implementation of the peace accords, and greater efforts to dismantle paramilitary groups. [size=no report]

On 12 June 2021, in Manizales (Caldas), around 120 protesters gathered in Alfonso Lopez plaza during ongoing anti-government demonstrations called by the National Strike Committee to demand health, education, and security reforms among others. The protesters also took part in artistic events to commemorate demonstrators reported as missing since the beginning of the National Strike. [size=around 120]

Around 11 June 2021, in Pueblo Bello (Cesar), nearly 18 Arhuacos indigenous people protested against the development of infrastructure projects that neglected the previous consultation with indigenous communities. The group raised awareness of the autonomy of indigenous communities in their territories. [size=nearly 18]

On 11 June 2021, in Ibague (Tolima), peaceful protesters rallied during ongoing anti-government demonstrations called by the National Strike Committee to demand health, education, and security reforms, among others. assoc_actor_1: CNP: National Strike Committee; Civilians (Colombia); Journalists (Colombia)
source: El Tiempo (Colombia); Colombia Reports; El Pais (Colombia); Diario La Libertad; El Colombiano; El Espectador; La Patria
notes: On 4 June 2021, in Santiago de Cali, Valle del Cauca, ESMAD forces clashed with demonstrators while destroying a barricade placed in Paseo del Comercio and in other neighborhoods. In the afternoon, rioters vandalized a police car and set fire to a public bus. 2 demonstrators were confirmed to have been shot dead by police forces during the clashes, though some sources claim as many as 5 demonstrators were killed. Meanwhile 50 others were injured, including four officers and a journalist. Journalists also reported they were attacked by the police. Unidentified shooters were seen firing at demonstrators in Siloe sector. Events took place during ongoing anti-government demonstrations called by the National Strike Committee to demand health, education, and security reforms among others. 2 fatalities. [size=no report]

notes: On 28 May 2021, in Santiago De Cali, Valle del Cauca, several clashes were reported during anti-government demonstrations called by the National Strike Committee to demand health, education, and security reforms among others. In Ciudad Jardin sector, at least five unidentified armed men shot at demonstrators and journalists, with the apparent approval of ten nearby police officers. In La Luna sector, an off-duty police officer shot at a crowd of demonstrators, killing two people. He was later lynched by a mob of demonstrators. At least 10 other deaths and 34 injuries - including demonstrators, police, ESMAD officers, and unidentified armed men, and an Inga indigenous student - were reported across the city, though conflicting reports disagree on how many of these could be directly linked to the demonstrations. 34 wounded, 13 fatalities. [size=no report]

Around 19 May 2021 (between 19 - 20 May), in Bogota - Ciudad Bolivar, Bogota, D.C., hooded rioters and ESMAD police clashed during the night near Las Colinas neighborhood. Rioters blocked the Panamericana road for seven hours and destroyed public and private properties. Police used tear gas to disperse them. The demonstration was part of ongoing nationwide anti-government movement called by the National Strike Committee over health, education, and security reforms among other things. They also called for an end to police brutality against demonstrators. [size=no report]

notes: On 17 May 2021, in Yumbo, Valle Del Cauca department, citizens participated in an anti-government demonstration organized by the National Strike Committee. The group took part in a nationwide strike to demand improvements in health, education, security, among other issues. Additionally, demonstrators rallied against the increasing number of reports on police brutality across the country. Demonstrators and ESMAD police forces clashed in the La Esperanza neighborhood. Police forces opened fire on a group of people that attacked a police station, injuring 16 people and killing one. Demonstrators vandalized the city hall and an oilfield. In total 30 people were reported injured, and a total of three persons were killed. 3 fatalities. [size=no report]

On 3 May 2021, in Santiago De Cali (Valle del Cauca), police - including ESMAD and special operations agents - used force to arrest and disperse rioters across the city participating in a nationwide anti-government demonstration organized by the National Strike Committee. The demonstration was held in commemoration of International Workers' Day and as part of the ongoing nationwide anti-government demonstration organized by the National Strike Committee. In total, 70 demonstrators were arrested after looting banks and setting a police car on fire while 13 demonstrators and 10 police were injured in confrontations. [size=some 17,000]

Around 1 May 2021 (as reported), in Anori (Antioquia), between 2,500 and 3,000 farmers rallied to protest against numerous government policies including its failure to implement peace accords with rebels, its use of fumigation for illegal crop eradication, and its persecution of traditional mining labor practices. The protest was also held in solidarity with the nationwide anti-government demonstrations called by the National Strike Committee and took place during a 7-day farmers' strike across 40 veredas in the region. [size=2,500 to 3,000]

On 1 May 2021, in Florida (Valle del Cauca), protesters blocked the Panamerican highway during ongoing nationwide anti-government demonstrations called by the National Strike Committee to demand improvements in health, education, and security among others. The protest continued for at least 22 days. [size=no report]

On 1 May 2021, in Pradera (Valle del Cauca), protesters blocked the Panamerican highway during ongoing nationwide anti-government demonstrations called by the National Strike Committee to demand improvements in health, education, and security among others. The protest continued for at least 22 days. [size=no report]

On 1 May 2021, in Santiago De Cali (Valle del Cauca), numerous rioters marched down 5th Street, looting, vandalizing, or setting aflame police stations, stores, banks, and a tollbooth during a nationwide anti-government demonstration organized by the National Strike Committee. Demonstrators reportedly injured 22 police officers, while ESMAD officers allegedly opened fire on the rioters, with over 200 people reported injured in total. The violence took place in the evening after a much larger, peaceful demonstration in the city. Three people were reported killed, one of them due to police clashes and two more victims by unidentified perpetrators. 3 fatalities. [size=numerous]

On 30 April 2021, in Pereira (Risaralda), for the third consecutive day, thousands of demonstrators gathered in opposition to tax reforms advanced by the Duque government. Some demonstrators looted or vandalized banks, stores, and bust stops. ESMAD Police intervened to disperse the rioters, who retaliated with stones and homemade explosives. The event was part of a country-wide movement organized by the National Strike Committee. [size=thousands]

On 28 April 2021, in Medellin (Antioquia), rioters demonstrated against new tax reforms advanced by the Duque government. The event was part of a country-wide movement organized by the National Strike Committee. Police intervened with tear gas and arrested 19 demonstrators, while the rioters injured 47 people and resulted in looting or vandalism of 15 banks, 9 stores, 7 bus stops, and 45 vehicles. 47 wounded, no fatalities. [size=no report]

On 28 April 2021, in Bogota (Bogota, D.C.), thousands of people in at least 14 points across the city demonstrated against tax reforms advanced by the Duque government. The event was part of a country-wide movement organized by the National Strike Committee. Some of the rallies turned violent and were countered by police and ESMAD forces, resulting in 35 damaged public transit stations, 174 damaged buses, 23 arrests, and 107 injuries (53 civilians and 54 officers). 107 wounded, no fatalities. During the evening, pot-banging demonstrations were also heard in several neighbourhoods as people demonstrated from their windows. [size=thousands]

notes: On 28 April 2021, in Popayan (Cauca), ESMAD police forces used tear gas against demonstrators opposed to tax reforms advanced by the Duque government, reportedly injuring 19 people including a journalist, a Patriotic March-affiliated human rights activist, and a law student who lost vision in his right eye after being hit by a tear gas grenade. Demonstrators reportedly responded by throwing stones and lighting a fire, injuring 3 police officers. 22 wounded, no fatalities. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Misak Indigenous Group (Colombia); Students (Colombia); Labour Group (Colombia); CNP: National Strike Committee
notes: On 28 April 2021, in Santiago De Cali (Valle del Cauca), ESMAD police used tear gas to disperse thousands of people - including students, union workers, and approximately 3,700 Misak indigenous people - demonstrating against tax reforms advanced by the Duque government. The event was part of a country-wide movement organized by the National Strike Committee. Demonstrators threw stones at police while also damaging 50 public buses and looted multiple banks and stores, while a group of Misak indigenous people toppled a statue of Sebastian de Belalcazar. Local organizations reported three people killed in clashes between demonstrators and security forces and one demonstrator shot dead by an unidentified armed perpetrator. 4 fatalities. [size=thousands]
